millsfield:images_texts:
NEL'England
CV-580
Welcome aboard Air New England's CV-580. Dependable alrcraft and experienced
crews are synonymous with Air New England's endeavor to make your flight a safe
and comfortable experience.
We do not anticipate any disruption of normal flight, but we wish to acquaint
you with the equipment and the facilities which Air New England has provided for
In all instances your flight crew, who have been thoroughly trained and drilled
in emergency
procedures, will direct and assist you, if necessary, in leaving the
aircraft rapidly and safely.
Please Do Not Remove This Card From The Aircraft
FRONT
WINDOW
EXITS
REAR
ENTRANCE Shall not be used as
an exit unless directed by a crew member
DOOR
WITH
EXIT
SLIDE
WINDOW EXITS
Grasp handle inside
Slot over window.
Pull
in and down.
Lift window. Turn on
side and throw out.
Face rear of cabin.
If over wing, step out
down on rear of wing
and slide to ground.
escape rope iron top of
window frame, climb out
window feet first
or slide to ground'
REAR DOOR EXIT
Turn handle to the
rear and up.
Push door out to open.
Pull red handle to
inflate slide.
Move away from aircraft quickly
(OVER)
Remove high heel
- lump onto
slide with feet up.

NELEngland
CV-580
Please Do Not Remove This Card From The Aircraft
Each passenger's seat must be in an upright position prior to taxiing, take-off, or
landing. Each passenger must comply with instructions given by a crew member
in compliance with this regulation.
AM, FM, and TV receivers may not be used during the flight. These devices may
disturb the navigation aids of the aircraft.
IMPORTANT INFORMATION
SEAT BELTS
Please keep your seat belt fastened when the seat belt sign is on. When the seat
belt sign is turned off in flight, we suggest you keep your seat belt loosely fastened.
Fasten
Tighten
Release
BRACE POSITION
1. Remove eyeglasses and sharp articles
from pockets.
2. Fasten seat belt tight and low across
hips.
3. Lean forward and down as far as possible.
4. Clasp hands firmly under legs.
FLOTATION CUSHION
Your seat cushion
is designed to
float.
Grasp seat cushion
and pull up.
(OVER)
Leave aircraft.
Hold on to straps
to keep afloat.
properties.sfomuseum:description: White background with black text and red outlines; airline name and "CV-580" along top edge in bold black letters; illustrations on front include how to open windows and door during emergencies and use of slide;  illustrations on verso include how to fasten seat belt, brace position, and use of flotation cushion
